thread.title: EastEnders viewers think they spot massive plot hole at the Queen Vic - but all is not what it seems
thread.title_full: EastEnders viewers think they spot massive plot hole at the Queen Vic - but all is not what it seems - Mirror Online

author: mirror.co.uk
title: EastEnders viewers think they spot massive plot hole at the Queen Vic - but all is not what it seems
text:
EastEnders viewers think they spot massive plot hole at the Queen Vic - but all is not what it seems They noticed that some things didn't add up on Albert Square when the pub sprung a leak   Share   Comments By Jennifer Crothers 10:16, 23 FEB 2017 Updated 10:26, 23 FEB 2017 TV Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch Next Former Eastenders star Ben Hardy to make televisi Watch this video again Watch Next Corrie fans SLAM unrealisticly sized newborn 0:31 Eagle-eyed EastEnders fans catch ‘staff’ lurking 0:31 EastEnders: Mick and Aunt Babe get ARRESTED in th 0:51 Kim is at it again as Denise tries to study 0:57 EastEnders spoiler: This is the moment Michelle F 0:20 Ronnie and Roxy ride in style in EastEnders 1:00 EastEnders release festive Christmas trailer - an 1:50 Sneak preview of this years EastEnders' Christmas 0:30 The Mitchell family gather around Phil's bed in h 0:54 EastEnders hints at Fatboy’s return following act 0:17 EastEnders: 'What if they plead not guilty?' - Pa 0:45 Video will play in  Mick thinks the Queen Vic is falling apart... Share this video Watch Next     soaps   EastEnders viewers have unearthed a great big plot hole in one of the soap's current storylines.
Fans of the show called out Albert Square writers over the Queen Vic leak plotline, saying it couldn't possibly be true... but it looks like this isn't the case.
Britain's best loved fictional pub was vandalised, then sprung a leak - which was discovered by an inspector when she tripped over a bucket collecting the water the leak from the ceiling was spewing forth.
Landlord Mick Carter (played by Danny Dyer) told the inspector, "You know how old this place is!" And that's when things seemingly to unravel.
Shirley and Mick stare wistfully at the leak (Photo: BBC) Mick (played by Danny Dyer) explained it was because the pub was so old (Photo: BBC) The offending ceiling leak (Photo: BBC) The Queen Vic, in all her wondrous glory Technically, the Vic was built "around 1860", according to the pub's backstory, and was renovated in 2010 after it suffered massive fire damage when Phil Mitchell burned the place down.
So, in short, the interior's just over six years old and some viewers got their knickers in a twist about it.
"The Vic old? It only got rebuilt post Phil burning it down a few years ago," tweeted one viewer, while another added, "The Vic ceiling must have been renewed the last time the gaff was torched?"
"The Vic old? It only got rebuilt post Phil burning it down a few years ago," tweeted another.
But it's not as straightfoward as that alleged structural anomaly.
"The Vic wasn't actually rebuilt after the fire," a source told Mirror Online. "It was just redecorated."
Which explains A LOT. "Viewers should keep watching and all will become clear," adds the source.
